metadata.case_name: Cotton Agents Limited, Bombay v. Commissioner of Income-tax, Bombay

facts.text: Cotton Agents Limited, Bombay (assessee Company) held a substantial number of shares of the New Swadeshi Mills of Ahmedabad, Ltd. (Mills Company).
Messrs. Shivnarayan Surajmal Nemani (Nemani group) held a block of shares of the Mills Company along with its managing agency.
Assessment year was 1946-47, accounting year ending with Diwali, 1945 (October 18, 1944, to November 4, 1945).

Sometime in 1944, differences arose between the assessee Company and the Nemani group; referred to Govindram Seksaria, who decided Nemani group should sell its block of shares to assessee Company at agreed price.
Assessee Company to pay Rs. 5,00,000 to Nemani group as price of managing agency rights.
Arrangement approved by shareholders of Mills Company by resolution dated January 4, 1945, effective immediately.
Assessee Company to come in as managing agents from April 1, 1944, entitled to emoluments from that date.
Managing agency commission from April 1, 1944, to December 31, 1944: Rs. 2,20,433; from January 1, 1945, to March 31, 1945: Rs. 67,959.
Assessee claimed taxable only on Rs. 67,959 for 1946-47; departmental authorities rejected, Tribunal accepted assessee's case.
Department assessed Nemani group also for commission April 1 to December 31, 1944; no intention to tax both.

Managing Agency Agreement dated March 15, 1925: Agents appointed for 51 years; remuneration 3-1/2% on gross proceeds of sales earned in any year or period for which accounts made up; becomes due at end of each financial year, payable after accounts passed by General Meeting.

legal_issues.text: Whether on the facts and circumstances of the case the managing agency commission at 3-1/2% on sales made by the New Swadeshi Mills of Ahmedabad Ltd., between April 1, 1944, and December 31, 1944, accrued to Shivnarayan Surajmal Nemani, or to the assessee?

petitioner_arguments.text: Managing agency commission based on sales accrued to managing agents as and when sales made; Rs. 5,00,000 paid included purchase price of managing agency commission accrued in hands of retiring agents (Nemani); under cl. 2, remuneration accrued at rate of 3-1/2% on gross proceeds of all sales as each sale took place; cl. 3 merely indicated time of payment, not accrual.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Clauses 2 and 3 of Managing Agency Agreement dated March 15, 1925

respondent_arguments.text: Whole of managing agency commission accrued to assessee; commission became due at end of financial year; right to receive depends on serving whole year.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Clauses 2 and 3 of Managing Agency Agreement; E. D. Sassoon and Company Ltd. v. Commissioner of Income-tax

court_reasoning.text: Cl. 3 is the accrual clause: commission becomes due at end of each financial year or period for which accounts laid before General Meeting; payable after accounts passed. Cl. 2 determines rate of calculation. No debt created or right to receive on each sale.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Remuneration accrued at end of financial year to assessee Company.

court_reasoning.text: Sassoon case not distinguished by basis of commission on sales vs. profits; key is when right to receive accrues, i.e., when debt created.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Income accrues when assessee acquires right to receive, i.e., debt owed.

holdings.text: Managing agency commission for April 1, 1944 to March 31, 1945 accrued to assessee Company at end of financial year.

precedents_cited.case_name: E. D. Sassoon and Company Ltd. v. Commissioner of Income-tax, Bombay City
precedents_cited.relevance: Accrual of income when right to receive created, i.e., debt due; commission accrues at end of year.

precedents_cited.case_name: Lakshminarayan Ram Gopal and Sons Ltd. v. The Government of Hyderabad
W. S. Try Ltd. v. Johnson
precedents_cited.relevance: Debitum in presenti, solvendum in futuro.

precedents_cited.case_name: Commissioners of Inland Revenue v. Gardner Mountain DAmbrumenil Ltd.
precedents_cited.relevance: Different agreements; commission arose when policies underwritten.

precedents_cited.case_name: Turner Morrison Co. Ltd. v. Commissioner of Income-tax, West Bengal
precedents_cited.relevance: Observations in context of place of receipt under s. 4(1)(a).

statutes_cited.name: Indian Income-tax Act, 1922
statutes_cited.relevance: Certificate for appeal from High Court.

outcome.summary: The appeal is concluded against the assessee; assessee liable to tax on whole managing agency commission as it accrued at end of financial year March 31, 1945.

key_quotes.text: Unless and until there is created in favour of the assessee a debt due by somebody it cannot be said that he had acquired a right to receive the income or that income has accrued to him.
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: Cl. 3 is the accrual clause it shows that the commission became due at the end of each financial year or other period for which the accounts of the Mills Company were to be laid before the General Meeting.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Interprets managing agency agreement on accrual timing.
